name: TheAtlantic
text: "Selling airfields is hardly a panacea, but some would fetch enough to allow cities to shore up their shaken balance sheets and, in certain cases, address some of the big issues they’ve been kicking down the road," @joefreelance writes: https://t.co/DnvNBJtjK3

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Lonely Work of Performing Funerals in Lima, Peru via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/08xTmPL0dN

name: TheAtlantic
text: At a time when in-person social interaction is so limited, podcasts can help bring chatter, and new voices, back into our lives and homes. The latest Atlantic Daily, from @mimbsy: https://t.co/A9JtikrOrB

name: TheAtlantic
text: Louis DeJoy assuaged concerns about the intent of his changes to the mail, but not about the consequences they might have for the election, @russellberman writes: https://t.co/XJuxfn6gpS

name: TheAtlantic
text: Even in the best White House relationships, presidents and their VPs run into differences. How they hash them out is a test of character, @ElizabethDrewOH writes. https://t.co/rW89wcm8g7

name: TheAtlantic
text: "It’s probably fair to say that 'Late Loving'—written as Mona Van Duyn neared her 43-year wedding anniversary—is not about nuclear destruction, and is about marriage. But it also probes deeper into other themes." https://t.co/2gE2duuUr3

name: TheAtlantic
text: Over the years, Ellen DeGeneres has gilded her agreeability with kindness. Yet if she were simply a goody-goody, it’d be hard to imagine her having the longevity she still enjoys. @skornhaber looks back over the star's career: https://t.co/PY0dh1L8q7

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Any investor can make mistakes. But Newton was no ordinary loser. He was the greatest mathematician alive," @TomLevenson writes: https://t.co/ZSLiTJi0vT

name: TheAtlantic
text: "My friends across the state are staring down disaster after disaster, suffering through climate change in action while they struggle with the ongoing pandemic," @leahstokes writes: https://t.co/qpYvNKW9QA

name: TheAtlantic
text: Anger over Trump's leadership has created an opening for progressives to reclaim the identity of so-called values voters. Raphael Warnock, the pastor of MLK's church, is working to flip a Georgia Senate seat. @emmaogreen reports: https://t.co/4qkCZOzgOa

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @whitdangerfield: Brooklyn teachers on why they might have to strike. “It’s Schrödinger’s reopening: The city both can afford to do it all and can’t afford what we had before," Katie Moylan and David Schepard write: https://t.co/x1Z5fkwcu1

name: TheAtlantic
text: Penguin huddles might look like chaos, writes @susan_dagostino, but in fact they operate with incredible efficiency. https://t.co/Tl4EOND6ni

name: TheAtlantic
text: America can afford to help struggling families, writes @jpinsk. Will it? https://t.co/OnTs6laaJv
